folders.name: Кладофоровые - Cladophoraceae
folders.comment: Cladophoraceae are a family of green algae in the order the Cladophorales. This family includes notably the genus Chaetomorpha which has a few members used in saltwater aquariums.
folders.title: Кладофоровые - Cladophoraceae

folders.thumbCaption:
Кладофоровые - Cladophorales

Cladophorales are an order of green algae, in the class Ulvophyceae.
There is a plausible fossil example in the mid-Ordovician Winneshiek shale.
folders.name: Кладофоровые - Cladophorales
folders.comment:
Cladophorales are an order of green algae, in the class Ulvophyceae.

folders.title: Кладофоровые - Cladophorales

folders.name: Ульвовые - Ulvaceae
folders.comment: The Sclerodermataceae are a family of fungi in the order Boletales, containing several genera of unusual fungi that little resemble boletes. Taxa, which include species commonly known as the ‘hard-skinned puffballs’, ‘earthballs’, or 'earthstars', are widespread in both temperate and tropical regions. The best known members include the earthball Scleroderma citrinum, the dye fungus Pisolithus tinctorius and the 'prettymouths' of the genus Calostoma.Ulvaceae (/ʌlˈveɪsii/) is a widely distributed family of thin green algae having either a flat or a hollow tubular thallus, reproducing by the conjugation of planogametes or of zoospores, and being classed among the Ulotrichales or now more commonly placed in the order Ulvales.
folders.title: Ульвовые - Ulvaceae

folders.thumbCaption:
Ульвовые - Ulvales

folders.name: Ульвовые - Ulvales

folders.title: Ульвовые - Ulvales

folders.name: Фукусовые - Fucaceae
folders.comment: The Fucaceae are a family of brown algae, containing six genera: Ascophyllum, Fucus, Hesperophycus, Pelvetia, Pelvetiopsis, Silvetia.
folders.title: Фукусовые - Fucaceae

folders.thumbCaption:
Фукусовые - Fucales

The Fucales (fucoids) are an order in the brown algae (class Phaeophyceae). The list of families in the Fucales, as well as additional taxonomic information on algae, is publicly accessible at Algaebase.
The class Phaeophyceae is included within the division Heterokontophyta. This name comes from the Greek word phaios meaning "brown" and phyton meaning plant. They include some of the largest organisms in the sea, but some are small and fine in structure.
folders.name: Фукусовые - Fucales
folders.comment:
